title: Modified Bishop Score for Vaginal Delivery and Induction of Labor
description: Predicts likelihood of successful vaginal delivery with additional parameters to the original Bishop score, using simplified cervical assessment criteria

parameters.name: fetal_station
parameters.description: Fetal station relative to ischial spines

result.name: bishop_score
result.description: Modified Bishop Score indicating cervical favorability for delivery

ranges.interpretation: Low likelihood of successful vaginal delivery. Consider cervical ripening agents before induction of labor. May require cesarean delivery.
Uncertain prediction for successful vaginal delivery. Clinical judgment required. Consider individual patient factors and obstetric history.
High likelihood of successful vaginal delivery. Induction of labor likely to be successful. Consider proceeding with induction.

references: Bishop EH. Pelvic scoring for elective induction. Obstet Gynecol. 1964 Aug;24:266-8. PMID: 14199536.
Laughon SK, Zhang J, Troendle J, Sun L, Reddy UM. Using a simplified Bishop score to predict vaginal delivery. Obstet Gynecol. 2011 Apr;117(4):805-11. doi: 10.1097/AOG.0b013e3182114ad2.

Kolkman DG, Verhoeven CJ, Brinkhorst SJ, van der Post JA, Pajkrt E, Opmeer BC, et al. The Bishop score as a predictor of labor induction success: a systematic review. Am J Perinatol. 2013 Sep;30(8):625-30. doi: 10.1055/s-0032-1331024.
formula: Sum of points from cervical dilation (0-6), cervical length (0-3), fetal station (0-3), cervical position (0-2), cervical consistency (0-2), plus modifiers for prior deliveries, pre-eclampsia, postdate pregnancy, nulliparity, and PPROM
notes: Modified version uses additional clinical factors beyond the original 5 Bishop score components
Score ≥8 indicates favorable cervix for induction
Score ≤5 suggests need for cervical ripening before induction
Clinical judgment should always be used in conjunction with the score
Original Bishop score uses effacement instead of cervical length in some versions
Simplified 3-component version (dilation, effacement, station) performs similarly to full score
